DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of this study is to examine whether patients can use the AliveCor case to record their heart rhythm and to assess the accuracy of the software in detecting AF vs sinus rhythm
DOC.brief_title: Using Smart Phone Technology in Detecting the Presence of Atrial Fibrillation
DOC.detailed_description: AliveCor is a new monitoring technology used with a smart phone which allows patients to record their rhythm. The study will compare AliveCor recordings and automated interpretation of the rhythm with the interpretation by an Electrophysiologist.
DOC.criteria: 1. Male or female between > 18 and < 80 years of age 2. Paroxysmal or persistent atrial fibrillation 3. Admitted for antiarrhythmic drug loading (Dofetilide or Sotalol) 4. Already has iPhone 4, 4S or 5 with data plan that accommodates the AliveCor case 5. Willing to use the Alive Cor case 6. Written informed consent 1. Unable or unwilling to use the Alive Cor case for their smart phone 2. Presence of a permanent pacemaker
